title: Optimalizing batching for diagnostics
body:
MiSeq samples are often very small, per chromosome batching is more time consuming than running the complete sample.

Solution:
before creating generate_template decide which data it is (based on bedfile in the samplesheet) and then select generate script with correct batching.

title: samplesheet should say which bed files to use for coverage calculations
body: A column (e.g. dataTypeRun) should say SSID, MiSeq, Exoom. This column will be read by the pipeline and step CoverageCalculations will only run the subset bedfiles based on the dataType

title: Quality by cycle metrics calculation needed?
body: CollectMultipleMetrics step is running for > 3 hours for WGS sample (but limited on a bedfile), maybe reducing walltime by removing unnecessary metrics calculations.

title: Store g.vcf as g.vcf.gz
body:
To decrease storage we should store all .g.vcf in gzip format
Question is if we should do it before the genotyping or after, depending on:

can g.vcf.gz be used by GATK GenotypeVariants

title: Bug: coping Manta file diploidSV.vcf.gz to resultsfolder

In step: CopyToResultsDir_0.sh, diploidSV.vcf.gz(per sample) is copied to results//variants/cnv/.

But the filename is the same foreach sample, resulting in overwriting each file.

title: QC_Report adding Concordance Result
body:
In QC report only the header of the concordance output is shown.
So you don't get the actual information you need to check if nothing has been swapped.

Maybe it would be better to show the entire table of the concordance output in the QC Report?

title: Remove empty spaces in collumnNames in the QC tables
body:
${EBROOTNGS_DNA}/report/pull_DNA_Seq_Stats.py: 
Maybe change collumnNames in the QC tables from "Fraction target covered >= 10x" back to "PCT_TARGET_BASES_20X" for easier parsing later on.

title: Use VEP instead of CmdLineAnnotator and SnpEff
Use MultiQC for making QC report
Issue old illumina encoding in s01_PrepareFastQ protocol
body:
When Illumina encoding ==1.9 there is an issue with zipping the fastq file:
This is caused by the mkfifo command, this can be solved by not using this command but to do the encoding and zipping seperatly

example:
else
                #make fastQ out of the fq.gz file
                #mkfifo "${barcodeFqGz}.encoded.fq"
                echo "converting Illumina encoding"
                seqtk seq "${barcodeFqGz}" -Q 64 -V > "${barcodeFqGz}".encoded.fq

                echo -e "done..\nNow gzipping ${barcodeFqGz}.encoded.fq > ${barcodeFinalFqGz}"
                pigz -c "${barcodeFqGz}.encoded.fq" > "${barcodeFinalFqGz}"

title: CopyPrmToTmp should do same procedure checksum as CopyRawToPrm (NGS_Automated)
make dependency on every side step of the pipeline when counting finished files
Some protocols are missing module list after a module load.
body: For example s20_SplitIndelsAndSNPs misses a ```module list``` after ```module load "GATK/3.7-Java-1.8.0_74"```. This makes it hard to debug issues as you don't know exactly which (versions of ) dependencies got loaded in the environment.

zip -gr "${projectResultsDir}/${project}.zip" variants

title: add rejectedbarcodes
protocol:s16b_GenotypeVariants,  batching for more that 200 sample fails
body:
1) number of samples is counted incorrect. It count the number of rows in the samplesheet instead of uniq sampleIds.
2) And when going in samplesize > 200 loop, it give an exit 1 error. 
3) line 'numberofbatches=$(("${SAMPLESIZE}" / 200))' gives always a syntax error.

title: Rejected barcodes for all projects instead of one
body: * If a samplesheet contains multiple projects and one of these projects contains a rejected barcode(s), all projects in this samplesheet get this rejectedBarcodes.txt file.

title: ANN info contains info for other ALT values
body:
ANN info contains info for other ALT values which makes interpretation of ANN values difficult and tricky.

Probable cause:
- SnpEff is run before splitting VCF per sample/alt
- ANN is copied for each splitted VCF

Solution:
Either copy only the relevant ANN part to the splitted files or run SnpEff on the splitted files.

title: CGD, only one inheritance per position possible
body: a region can contain multiple genes, but there is only one value possible for the CGD fields

title: Style errors in string definitions
body:
Style errors in `#string parameter` definitions (probably all tabs):

```
umcg-mterpstra:NGS_DNA grep '^#string\|^#list' protocols/MarkDuplicates.sh| grep -vP '\#string |\#list '
#string	project
```

title: Adding more/better decomposition
body:
This code splits multiallelics:

https://github.com/molgenis/NGS_DNA/blob/5decff4a8334c3d81c41fbdeeb9f402dff861291/protocols/AnnotateVcf.sh#L47

aka
```
1 100 A C,T 
```
to
```
1 100 A C
1 100 A T
```
It doesn't split:

https://genome.sph.umich.edu/wiki/Vt#Decompose_biallelic_block_substitutions

aka
```
1 100 AT CG 
```
to
```
1 100 A C
1 101 T G
```

This causes a lot of problems for variant annotation/interpretation and to a degree affects comparing different variantcallers to eachother. There is no clear solution for this I just want to leave this here as a open end to improve the pipeline close it of you want.

also reading up to the current standard bcftools norm 1.12 has the --atomize flag maybe update bcftools version?
